metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7796 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The manager_dispatch_notify_fd function in systemd allows local users to cause a denial of service (system hang) via a zero-length message received over a notify socket, which causes an error to be returned and the notification handler to be disabled.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7796` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 229-4ubuntu11
libnss-mymachines - 229-4ubuntu11
libnss-resolve - 229-4ubuntu11
libpam-systemd - 229-4ubuntu11
libsystemd0 - 229-4ubuntu11
libudev1 - 229-4ubuntu11
systemd - 229-4ubuntu11
systemd-container - 229-4ubuntu11
systemd-coredump - 229-4ubuntu11
systemd-journal-remote - 229-4ubuntu11
systemd-sysv - 229-4ubuntu11
udev - 229-4ubuntu11
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> trusty (and vivid-phone) is not affected as init is upstart there

criterions.comment: systemd package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '229-4ubuntu11').
